alert.note: Alert for Montour; Northumberland; Southern Lycoming; Union (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 4:19AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN NORTHUMBERLAND... NORTHWESTERN MONTOUR...SOUTHEASTERN LYCOMING...NORTHWESTERN COLUMBIA AND NORTHEASTERN UNION COUNTIES THROUGH 500 AM EDT... At 417 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Williamsport to near Lewisburg to Mifflinburg to 11 miles west of Selinsgrove. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Milton, Lewisburg, Mifflinburg, Muncy, Watsontown, Hughesville, Montgomery, Linntown, New Columbia, Montandon, Allenwood, Vicksburg, Jerseytown, Iola, Elimsport, Lairdsville, Forest Hill, Sand Bridge State Park, Spruce Run Reservoir and Exchange. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
